title: JavaScript (deprecated)
description: Connector for document routines written in JavaScript to fetch content from filesystems and websites.

type.title: Datasource Type
type.description: Datasource type supported by the selected connector type.

pipeline.title: Pipeline ID
pipeline.description: Name of an existing index pipeline for processing documents.

type_description.title: Type Description
type_description.default: Connector for document routines written in JavaScript to fetch content from filesystems and websites.

collection.title: Collection
collection.description: Collection documents will be indexed to.

db.title: Connector DB
db.description: Type and properties for a ConnectorDB implementation to use with this datasource.

type.title: Implementation Class Name
type.description: Fully qualified class name of ConnectorDb implementation.

inlinks.title: Process Inlinks?
inlinks.description: Keep track of incoming links. This negatively impacts performance and size of DB.

aliases.title: Process Aliases?
aliases.description: Keep track of original URI-s that resolved to the current URI. This negatively impacts performance and size of DB.

inv_aliases.title: Process Inverted Aliases?
inv_aliases.description: Keep track of target URI-s that the current URI resolves to. This negatively impacts performance and size of DB.

startLinks.title: Start Links
startLinks.description: One or more starting URIs for this datasource.

dedupe.title: Dedupe documents
dedupe.description: If true, documents will be deduplicated. Deduplication can be done based on an analysis of the content, on the content of a specific field, or by a JavaScript function. If neither a field nor a script are defined, content analysis will be used.

dedupeField.title: Dedupe field
dedupeField.description: Field to be used for dedupe. Define either a field or a dedupe script, otherwise the full raw content of each document will be used.

dedupeScript.title: Dedupe script
dedupeScript.description: Custom javascript to dedupe documents. The script must define a 'genSignature(content){}' function, but can use any combination of document fields. The function must return a string.

dedupeSaveSignature.title: Save dedupe signature
dedupeSaveSignature.description: If true,the signature used for dedupe will be stored in a 'dedupeSignature_s' field. Note this may cause errors about 'immense terms' in that field.

delete.title: Delete dead URIs
delete.description: Set to true to remove documents from the index when they can no longer be accessed as unique documents.

deleteErrorsAfter.title: Fetch failure allowance
deleteErrorsAfter.description: Number of fetch failures to tolerate before removing a document from the index. The default of -1 means no fetch failures will be removed.

fetchThreads.title: Fetch threads
fetchThreads.description: The number of threads to use during fetching. The default is 5.

emitThreads.title: Emit threads
emitThreads.description: The number of threads used to send documents from the connector to the index pipeline. The default is 5.

chunkSize.title: Fetch batch size
chunkSize.description: The number of items to batch for each round of fetching. A higher value can make crawling faster, but memory usage is also increased. The default is 1.

fetchDelayMS.title: Fetch delay
fetchDelayMS.description: Number of milliseconds to wait between fetch requests. The default is 0. This property can be used to throttle a crawl if necessary.

refreshAll.title: Recrawl all items
refreshAll.description: Set to true to always recrawl all items found in the crawldb.

refreshStartLinks.title: Recrawl start links
refreshStartLinks.description: Set to true to recrawl items specified in the list of start links.

refreshErrors.title: Recrawl errors
refreshErrors.description: Set to true to recrawl items that failed during the last crawl.

refreshOlderThan.title: Recrawl age
refreshOlderThan.description: Number of seconds to recrawl items whose last fetched date is longer ago than this value.

refreshIDPrefixes.title: Recrawl ID prefixes
refreshIDPrefixes.description: A prefix to recrawl all items whose IDs begin with this value.

refreshIDRegexes.title: Recrawl ID regexes
refreshIDRegexes.description: A regular expression to recrawl all items whose IDs match this pattern.

refreshScript.title: Recrawl script
refreshScript.description: A JavaScript function ('shouldRefresh()') to customize the items recrawled.

forceRefresh.title: Force recrawl
forceRefresh.description: Set to true to recrawl all items even if they have not changed since the last crawl.

forceRefreshClearSignatures.title: Clear signatures
forceRefreshClearSignatures.description: If true, signatures will be cleared if force recrawl is enabled.

retryEmit.title: Retry emits
retryEmit.description: Set to true for emit batch failures to be retried on a document-by-document basis.

depth.title: Max crawl depth
depth.description: Number of levels in a directory or site tree to descend for documents.

maxItems.title: Max items
maxItems.description: Maximum number of documents to fetch. The default (-1) means no limit.

failFastOnStartLinkFailure.title: Fail crawl if start links are invalid
failFastOnStartLinkFailure.description: If true, when Fusion cannot connect to any of the provided start links, the crawl is stopped and an exception logged.

crawlDBType.title: Crawl database type
crawlDBType.description: The type of crawl database to use, in-memory or on-disk.

commitAfterItems.title: Commit After This Many Items
commitAfterItems.description: Commit the crawlDB to disk after this many items have been received. A smaller number here will result in a slower crawl because of commits to disk being more frequent; conversely, a larger number here will cause a resumed job after a crash to need to recrawl more records.

initial_mapping.title: Initial field mapping
initial_mapping.description: Provides mapping of fields before documents are sent to an index pipeline.

skip.title: Skip This Stage
skip.description: Set to true to skip this stage.

label.title: Label
label.description: A unique label for this stage.

condition.title: Condition
condition.description: Define a conditional script that must result in true or false. This can be used to determine if the stage should process or not.

source.title: Source Field
source.description: The name of the field to be mapped.

target.title: Target Field
target.description: The name of the field to be mapped to.

operation.title: Operation
operation.description: The type of mapping to perform: move, copy, delete, add, set, or keep.

unmapped.title: Unmapped Fields
unmapped.description: If fields do not match any of the field mapping rules, these rules will apply.

source.title: Source Field
source.description: The name of the field to be mapped.

target.title: Target Field
target.description: The name of the field to be mapped to.

operation.title: Operation
operation.description: The type of mapping to perform: move, copy, delete, add, set, or keep.

excludeExtensions.title: Excluded file extensions
excludeExtensions.description: File extensions that should not to be fetched. This will limit this datasource to all extensions except this list.

excludeRegexes.title: Exclusive regexes
excludeRegexes.description: Regular expressions for URI patterns to exclude. This will limit this datasource to only URIs that do not match the regular expression.

includeExtensions.title: Included file extensions
includeExtensions.description: File extensions to be fetched. This will limit this datasource to only these file extensions.

includeRegexes.title: Inclusive regexes
includeRegexes.description: Regular expressions for URI patterns to include. This will limit this datasource to only URIs that match the regular expression.

retainOutlinks.title: Retain links in the crawldb
retainOutlinks.description: Set to true for links found during fetching to be stored in the crawldb. This increases precision in certain recrawl scenarios, but requires more memory and disk space.

aliasExpiration.title: Alias expiration
aliasExpiration.description: The number of crawls after which an alias will expire. The default is 1 crawl.

restrictToTree.title: Restrict crawl to start-link tree
restrictToTree.description: If true, only documents found in a tree below the start links will be fetched. By default, this means limiting the crawl to the domain of the start links. For example, if the start link is 'http://host.com/US' then only links to the 'host.com' domain will be followed. Further options are available for modifying this behavior.

restrictToTreeAllowSubdomains.title: Ignore sub-domains when restricting crawl
restrictToTreeAllowSubdomains.description: Modifies the behavior of 'Restrict crawl to start-link tree' so that a link to any sub-domain of the start links is allowed. For example, if the start link is 'http://host.com', this option ensures that links to 'http://news.host.com' are also followed. This option requires 'Restrict to start-link tree' to be enabled to have any effect.

restrictToTreeUseHostAndPath.title: Restrict crawl to start-link path
restrictToTreeUseHostAndPath.description: Modifies the behavior of 'Restrict crawl to start-link tree' to include the 'path' of the start link in the restriction logic. For example, if the start link is 'http://host.com/US', this option will limit all followed URLs to ones starting with the '/US/' path. This option requires 'Restrict to start-link tree' to be enabled to have any effect.

restrictToTreeIgnoredHostPrefixes.title: Restrict crawl host prefix exemptions
restrictToTreeIgnoredHostPrefixes.description: Modifies the behavior of 'Restrict crawl to start-link tree' to ignore the configured list of prefixes when restricting the crawl. Commonly, 'www.' is ignored so links with the same domain are allowed, whether of the form 'http://host.com' or 'http://www.host.com'. This option requires 'Restrict to start-link tree' to be enabled to have any effect.

rewriteLinkScript.title: URI rewrite script
rewriteLinkScript.description: A Javascript function 'rewriteLink(link) { }' to modify links to documents before they are fetched.

diagnosticMode.title: Diagnostic mode
diagnosticMode.description: Enable to print more detailed information to the logs about each request.
